bhtAttempts.bht: The sin mentioned in this verse, which is also written about in Matthew 12:31 and Mark 3:28, is the blasphemy against the Holy Ghost. It is the sin of attributing the miracles of Jesus to the power of the devil, rather than acknowledging the work of the Holy Spirit. This sin is considered unpardonable, as it rejects and resists the power of the Spirit. However, judgment is given differently for those who speak a word against the Son of Man, as forgiveness is offered for that sin. It is important to note that even though some sins may be forgiven upon true repentance, this particular sin against the Holy Ghost is one that shall never be forgiven.
